author: Bob Brody
title: The Case Against Deliberate Deafness
text:
Lost in San Francisco, I asked a 20-something woman for directions. She looked puzzled and peeled off her headphones: “I’m sorry. What did you say?” The same happened with a 30-ish man in Washington: “Excuse me,” he said, unplugging his earbuds. “What?”
It’s no secret that many people out in public are staring down at a phone screen, divorced from physical reality. They’ve turned a blind eye on the world. Similarly, people wearing some kind of earpiece, cut off from sound, have turned a deaf ear to the world.
